intro: Chrysophyllum aulacocarpum, commonly known as the Natal plum, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces edible, yellowish-orange fruits that are rich in vitamin C and have a sweet, tangy flavor. Its botanical features include a smooth, greyish bark and a preference for well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruits.
